definition: forgetful/empty-headed
to lose/to put aside/to throw
surname San
three/3
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
four/4

sentences.english: Xiao Zhao is always forgettable . We usually look for different stuff for him.
sentences.chinese: 小昭常常丟三落四的，大家常常幫他找東西。

sentences.english: My secretary is constantly losing things.
sentences.chinese: 我的美術總是丟三落四。

sentences.english: He decided, once and for all, not to be forgetful in the future.
sentences.chinese: 他下定決心，從此絕不再丟三落四了。

sentences.english: Why are you always losing things?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼你總是丟三落四的？

sentences.english: I’ve been forgetful lately. I’ve been forgetful these days.
sentences.chinese: 最近我總是丟三落四的。
因上了年紀他變得丟三落四的。
我最近總是丟三落四的。

sentences.english: Your scatty son has forgotten his key again.
sentences.chinese: 你那兒子丟三落四又把鑰匙給忘了。
最近我老是丟三落四的。

definition: lit. chicken feathers and garlic skins (idiom)/fig. trivial (matter)
to be strict with oneself
to haggle over every ounce/(fig.) to fuss over minor matters/to split hairs
lit. to penetrate into a bull's horn (idiom); fig. to waste time on an insoluble or insignificant problem/to bash one's head against a brick wall/a wild goose chase/a blind alley/to split hairs
to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)/to aim too high
to be cynical/to be embittered
habit becomes nature (idiom); get used to something and it seems inevitable/second nature
to find amusement in one's own way/to enjoy oneself quietly
to make a fuss about nothing (idiom)
satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
thick stems and broad leaves (idiom)/boorish/rough and ready/sloppy
to imitate the dog and steal chicken (idiom)/to pilfer/to dally with women/to have affairs
man of Qǐ fears the sky falling (idiom); groundless fears
Trouble issues from the mouth (idiom). A loose tongue may cause a lot of trouble.
coming and going alone (idiom); a lone operator/keeping to oneself/unsociable/maverick
lit. deep plans and distant thoughts/to plan far ahead (idiom)
